name: adobe_experience_platform_xdm_system
author: Wendy Braun
meta_keywords: Adobe Experience Platform, Services, Experience Platform, Data Services, XDM, Experience Data Model, Schema Registry, Schema, XDM System
meta_description: Driven by Adobe, Experience Data Model (XDM) is an effort to standardize customer experience data and define schemas for customer experience management. XDM System operationalizes Experience Data Model schemas to support the interoperability of data across Experience Platform components.

pages.title: XDM System overview
pages.description: Experience Platform uses schema-based workflows to support the interoperability and standardization of data across Platform components such as Catalog, Unified Profile Service, Query Service, and Data Science Workspace.

pages.title: XDM field dictionary
pages.description: Experience Data Model (XDM) defines a set of resources with specific definitions and consistent behaviors to support standardization across Adobe Experience Platform.

pages.title: Basics of schema composition
pages.description: An introduction to schemas and the building blocks, principles, and best practices for composing schemas to be used with Adobe Experience Platform.

pages.title: Schema Registry developer guide
pages.description: The Schema Registry provides a RESTful API to perform operations against all Schema Library resources within Experience Platform.

pages.title: Create a schema using the Schema Registry API
pages.description: Follow step-by-step instructions to compose a schema using the Schema Registry API, including assigning a class and defining mixins.

pages.title: Create a schema using the Schema Editor
pages.description: Learn how to compose a schema and interact with the Schema Registry using the Schema Editor in Experience Platform.

pages.title: Define a relationship between two schemas using the Schema Registry API
pages.description: Follow step-by-step instructions for defining a one-to-one relationship between two schemas using the Schema Registry API.

pages.title: Define a relationship between two schemas using the Schema Editor
pages.description: Follow step-by-step instructions for defining a one-to-one relationship between two schemas using the Schema Editor.

pages.title: XDM System troubleshooting guide
pages.description: Find answers to frequently asked questions about XDM System and Experience Data Model (XDM), including troubleshooting for common errors.
